steps.title: The Content section
steps.content:
In this tour you will get a short introduction to the Content section in Umbraco.

The Content section is where all the pages and content for the website lives.

You will learn how to navigate the content, update some content, and preview the website.

steps.title: Navigate to the Content section
steps.content:
In the Content section you can create and manage the content of the website.

The Content section contains the content of your website. Content is displayed as nodes in the content tree.

steps.title: The Home page
steps.content:
The first node you will see in the content tree is the Home page.

Click on the arrow on the left of the Home page to see the pages underneath the Home page.

steps.title: The site structure
steps.content: In the content tree you will see the site structure. You can expand trees by clicking the arrow to the left of the node.

steps.title: Open the Home page
steps.content:
Let's have a look at what the content of a page could look like.

Click on the Home page name to open the node.

steps.title: The page name
steps.content: At the top of the page you will find the name of the content you are editing.

steps.title: Properties
steps.content:
In the center of the page you will find the content Properties.

These are all the pieces of information the content consist of. Properties can vary depending on which Document type the current item is based on.

steps.title: Organise with groups
steps.content: The properties of a page are organised in groups making it easy to find the right place to update the content.

steps.title: Preview content
steps.content:
Before a page is published to your website you can preview any changes you have made to the page.

Click the Preview button to see how the page looks now.

steps.title: Update the header
steps.content:
Let's make an update to the content in the Header property.

Try changing it to: Welcome to my website

steps.title: Preview update
steps.content: Click the Preview button to see the changes you've just made.

steps.title: Save and Publish
steps.content: Click on the Publish button to publish the changes and make them visible to the public.

steps.title: Creating your first content page
steps.content: In this tour you will learn how to create new content for your website.

steps.title: Navigate to the Content section
steps.content:
In the Content section you can create and manage the content of the website.

The Content section contains the content of your website. Content is displayed as nodes in the content tree.

steps.title: Open the context menu
steps.content:
Open the context menu by hovering the Home node.

Now click the three small dots to the right.

steps.title: Create new Content Page
steps.content:
Now you can see all the options you have for creating content in this part of the site.

Select the Content Page option to create a new page of that type.

steps.title: Give your new page a name
steps.content: Our new page needs a name. Enter My Page in the field and click Next.

steps.title: Add a page title
steps.content:
On this page we are also required to fill out the Page Title property.

Enter Welcome to My Page in the field and click Next.

steps.title: Save as draft
steps.content:
Before we can preview the page we need to save it as a draft.

Click the Save option to save your changes without making them public.

steps.title: Preview
steps.content: Click the Preview button to preview the new page before publishing it.

steps.title: Go explore
steps.content: The page still looks a bit empty. You can now try and fill out some of the other properties on the page.

steps.title: How to use the media library
steps.content:
A website would be boring without media content. In Umbraco you can manage all your images, documents, videos etc. in the Media section. Here you can upload and organise your media items and see details about each item.

In this tour you will learn how to upload and organise your Media library in Umbraco. It will also show you how to view details about a specific media item.

steps.title: Navigate to the Media section
steps.content: The Media section is where you manage all your media items.

steps.title: The media tree
steps.content: Like the Content section the Media section also has a tree.

steps.title: Folders
steps.content:
In this Starter kit we have added a couple of folders. One of them is called Design.

This folder is meant to hold all the design related media items like background images etc.

Click the folder name to open the folder.

steps.title: Upload area
steps.content: Inside a folder you will find an area to upload your media files...

steps.title: Uploaded media
steps.content: ...and an area with all your uploaded files.

steps.title: Upload a background image
steps.content:
Let's upload a new image we can use as background image on the Home page in the next tour.

Click the or click here to choose files-button and select an image on your computer to upload.

steps.title: View media item details
steps.content: Hover the media item and Click the white bar to view details about the media item.

steps.title: The uploaded image
steps.content: Here you can see the image you have uploaded.

steps.title: Image size
steps.content:
You will also find other details about the image, like the size.

Media items work in much the same way as content. Properties can vary depending on which Media type the current item belongs to.

steps.title: Info
steps.content: Under the Info-app you will find default information about the media item.

steps.title: Link to media
steps.content: The path to the media item...

steps.title: General information
steps.content: ...and information about when the media item has been created and edited.

steps.title: Adding media to content
steps.content:
In this tour you will learn how to add media to a content page using a Media picker.

Your will use the image you uploaded to the Design folder as a new background image for the Home page.

steps.title: Navigate to the Content section
steps.content: Click the Content section icon to open the content section.

steps.title: Home
steps.content: Click the Home node to open it.

steps.title: Design
steps.content: Under the Design group you will find the property to change the background image.

steps.title: Remove the current image
steps.content:
First we need to remove the current image so we can add our new image.

Hover the image and Click on the red X i the bottom right corner of the image.

steps.title: Open the Media picker
steps.content: Click the Add icon to open the Media Picker.

steps.title: Select image
steps.content:
This Media picker is configured to only show images from the Design folder.

Click on the image you just uploaded to select it.

steps.title: Submit dialog
steps.content: Click Select image to add the selected image.

steps.title: Preview
steps.content: Click Preview to see the changed background image.

steps.title: Remember to Save or Publish
steps.content: If you want to keep the changes you've made, remember to Save or Publish the content item.
